column4: If you install and use Ubuntu Tweak, you can change the default apps for all kinds of media from a single menu.
How about hiding partitions/volumes in the File Browser? (i hae a windows partition i want to make sure i never touch)
If you never want to touch it, just don't mount it at boot.
How do i not mount it at boot?  i just installed ubuntu, and it automounts all my partitions
Do you know how to edit fstab from the command line?
You know how to use the command line at all?
ya, i know how to enter commands haha
Okay.  I'm not sure what text editor you have installed, so the command I'm going to give will have to be changed for whatever it is.  I use one called pico.
Look for a line that will be labeled showing where the windows partition is currently being mounted.  Comment out the line after that with a #.  Then save.
